Training Gadgets & Ranch Upgrades
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 4 Archive (PS2): FAQ: Training Gadgets & Ranch Upgrades
By Lisa Shock on Tuesday, November 18, 2003 - 09:03 pm:

*For Gadgeteer months, check the calendar!*


Training Level 1 is the no gadget drilling you begin the game with.

Training Level 2 2000G per gadget
NameSpaceDescriptionStat1TiredFulness
Sandbag1x2The Punching Bag, a great place to start Raising Strength! Punch that thing, monster! Build those muscles!Pow++++-
Book1x2It's content changes depending on your monster's abilities. It had better start at the beginning...Int++++-
Target2x3Aim well, monster! Your goal is to be the champion of the future!Acc++++-
Trampoline1x1Use the power of the trampoline and jump, monster, jump! Maybe it'll learn some wonderful new footwork.Spd++++-
Tub1x2The tub flies up and your monster catches it on its head. Don't try this at home. Def++++-
Life Blade1x1Your monster moves the blade rhythmically to increase Life. It's harder than it looks. Lif++++-

Rock2x2It's weight adjusts according to your monster's abilities. (Even if your monster drops it, it's not that heavy.)Pow++Def-++--
Stonehenge2x2Its magic makes meditation more effective! Don't let your monster train too much or it'll get tired!Int++Spd-++--

Training Level Special 12000G per gadget

Wall Push2x3Your monster has to hunker down and push, monster, push! If it's is successful, you get money.Pow++Acc-++--
Picture3x2Like a little theater! Your monster can forget its cares. But if it relaxes too much, it might forget to eat.Int++Pow-++--

Revolving Bar2x2Your monster has to jump to avoid the bar as it approaches. It gives you money and increases focus, but it's tiring.Spd++Def-++--
Slap Machine2x2Tough love. If you love your monster you'll make it do this. Increases the monster's focus and toughens it up.Def++Lif-++
Spa3x3Its heat adjusts according to your monster's abilities. It reduces stress, but makes your monster hungry.Lif++Spd-++

Ranch
ItemDescriptionSize
Poor HouseA simple straw house. Hot in the summer and cold in winter. Holds up to 4 training gadgets.2x2
Poor HutA no-frills hut. Cold wind comes in through the cracks. You can raise only one monster here.2x2
Normal HouseIt's bigger than it looks at first glance. Holds up to 8 training gadgets.2x2
Normal HutThe most common type of hut, it's relatively strong and big. You can raise up to 3 monsters here.2x3
Great HouseWith its stylish design, its a breeder status symbol. Holds up to 16 training gadgets.3x3
Great HutA big, beautiful, deluxe monster hut! You can raise up to 5 monsters here.3x4


Ranches
RanchDescriptionSize
Ranch 1One monster, 5 Gadgets allowed.4x4
Ranch 2Three monsters, 7 Gadgets allowed.6x4
Ranch 3Five monsters, ten Gadgets allowed.8x6


Thanks to Artificer, D Knight, Golden Boy, Kimochi, RyuDragon, TjMax, Shen the Keeper, VenomousX
By GoldenBoy on Sunday, November 30, 2003 - 05:02 pm:

Using Medals

Once you have received the Medal from Wit ingame, and have been visited by Swift, the purple haired Gadgeteer, you can make modified gadgets using medals you can find on expedition.

There are 4 types of Medal:
TypeEffect
IntenseIncreases focus, but your monster will become hungry faster.
LuckyEach drill will get you money.
HealingReduces stress, but your monster becomes lazy (less focus).
MagicImproves gains, but increases fatigue


Once you have any of them in your inventory you can modify one gadget per medal you find. In Swift's Buy screens there will be 4 variants for each training gadget you have found and appraised. You can look at any variant, but you can only buy versions for medals you have on hand. He will ask you if you want to use the medal, and when you accept, the new gadget will be in your inventory. You can then sell back your "normal" version.

Swift's appearance is partially random, but for most people, consistant in the 2yr6mo - 3yr range.

Thx to Infernus and Shikane
